metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27784 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel, where accessing a deallocated instance in printer_ioctl() printer_ioctl() tries to access of a printer_dev instance. However, use-after-free arises because it had been freed by gprinter_free().

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1091-aws - 4.15.0-1091.96
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1030-aws - 5.4.0-1030.31~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132').
